data.enText: crime

data.chText: 做出（错或非法的事）；犯（罪或错等）
data.enText: to do sth wrong or illegal
to commit murder/adultery , etc.

data.chText: 多数罪行都是年轻人犯下的。
data.enText: Most crimes are committed by young men.

data.chText: 对无辜儿童犯下的骇人听闻的罪行
data.enText: appalling crimes committed against innocent children
suicide
to kill yourself deliberately
promise/say definitely

data.chText: 承诺，保证（做某事、遵守协议或遵从安排等）
data.enText: to promise sincerely that you will definitely do sth, keep to an agreement or arrangement, etc.

data.chText: 总统承诺要改革卫生保健制度。
data.enText: The President is committed to reforming health care.

data.chText: 借款人应当慎重考虑之后再行借贷。
data.enText: Borrowers should think carefully before committing themselves to taking out a loan.

data.chText: 双方承诺和平解决争端。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: Both sides committed themselves to settle the dispute peacefully.

data.chText: （公开地）表示意见，作出决定（以致日后难以更改）
data.enText: to give an opinion or make a decision openly so that it is then difficult to change it

data.chText: 你不必现在表态，只需考虑一下这件事。
data.enText: You don't have to commit yourself now, just think about it.
be loyal

data.chText: 忠于（某个人、机构等）；全心全意投入（工作、活动等）
data.enText: to be completely loyal to one person, organization, etc. or give all your time and effort to your work, an activity, etc.

data.chText: 为什么有这么多的男人害怕许诺忠诚于人？
data.enText: Why are so many men scared to commit? (= say they will be loyal to one person)
money/time
to spend money or time on sth/sb

data.chText: 市政会在住宅项目上投入了大量资金。
data.enText: The council has committed large amounts of money to housing projects.
to hospital/prison

data.chText: （下令）把（某人）送进（医院或监狱等）
data.enText: to order sb to be sent to a hospital, prison, etc.
She was committed to a psychiatric hospital.
sb for trial
to send sb for trial in court
sth to memory
to learn sth well enough to remember it exactly
She committed the instructions to memory.
sth to paper/writing
to write sth down

simple_means.memory_skill: com 共同 + mit 送，放出 → 共同派送 → 委任

means: 承诺，保证(做某事、遵守协议或遵从安排等)
（公开地）表示意见，作出决定（以致日后难以更改）
（下令）把（某人）送进（医院或监狱等）

tr: give entirely to a specific person, activity, or cause
example: She committed herself to the work of God
give one's talents to a good cause
consecrate your life to the church
After the second episode, she had to be committed
The messenger was entrusted with the general's secret
I commit my soul to God
commit a random act of kindness

tr: perform an act, usually with a negative connotation

value.def: If someone commits a crime or a sin, they do something illegal or bad.

example.ex: I have never committed any crime...
This is a man who has committed murder.

value.def: If someone commits suicide, they deliberately kill themselves.

example.ex: There are unconfirmed reports he tried to commit suicide.
example.tran: 有未经证实的报道说他曾企图自杀。

value.def: If you commit money or resources to something, you decide to use them for a particular purpose.

example.ex: They called on Western nations to commit more money to the poorest nations...
example.tran: 他们呼吁西方国家向极端贫困国家投入更多的钱。

example.ex: The government had committed billions of pounds for a programme to reduce acid rain...
example.tran: 政府已经给一个旨在减少酸雨的方案拨了几十亿英镑。

example.ex: He should not commit American troops without the full consent of Congress.
example.tran: 没有国会的完全同意，他不应该调遣美国军队。

value.def: If you commit yourself to something, you say that you will definitely do it. If you commit yourself to someone, you decide that you want to have a long-term relationship with them.

example.ex: I would advise people to think very carefully about committing themselves to working Sundays...
example.tran: 我建议大家慎重考虑一下答应周日工作的问题。

example.ex: I'd like a friendship that might lead to something deeper, but I wouldn't want to commit myself too soon...
example.tran: 我希望拥有一份能进一步发展的友谊，但又不想太快作出承诺。

example.ex: You don't have to commit to anything over the phone.
example.tran: 你不用在电话里承诺什么。

example.ex: He said the government remained committed to peace.
example.tran: 他说政府仍然致力于和平。

value.def: If you do not want to commit yourself on something, you do not want to say what you really think about it or what you are going to do.

example.ex: It isn't their diplomatic style to commit themselves on such a delicate issue...
example.tran: 对这样一个微妙的问题明确表态并非他们的外交风格。

example.ex: She didn't want to commit herself one way or the other.
example.tran: 不管怎样，她都不想明确表态。

value.def: If someone is committed to a hospital, prison, or other institution, they are officially sent there for a period of time.

example.ex: Arthur's drinking caused him to be committed to a psychiatric hospital.
example.tran: 阿瑟由于酗酒被送进一家精神病医院。

value.tran: 把…正式送进(医院、监狱等)

value.def: In the British legal system, if someone is committed for trial, they are sent by magistrates to stand trial in a crown court.

example.ex: He is expected to be committed for trial at Liverpool Crown Court.
example.tran: 预计他会被移交利物浦高等刑事法庭。

value.def: If you commit something to paper or to writing, you record it by writing it down. If you commit something to memory, you learn it so that you will remember it.

example.ex: She had not committed anything to paper about it...
example.tran: 关于这件事她未曾写下只言片语。

example.ex: I'll repeat that so you can commit it to memory.
example.tran: 我会重复一下，好让你们记住。

trans: 承担义务，做出承诺（要求等）说出肯定的意见

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to send, to cast 送, 放出
rootsaffixes.title: miss, mit

partsOfSpeech.dec: ad 加强 + mit 送，放出 → 送来 → 准许…进入
com 共同 + miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 共同送出〔选出〕的人 → 委员会
com 共同 + mit 送，放出 → 共同派送 → 委任
dis 加强 + miss 送，放出 → 不断把人送出 → 解散
e 出 + miss 送，放出 + ary 表人 → 派出去的人 → 使者
e 出 + mit 送，放出 → 放出〔气味、光亮〕等 → 发光；发出〔气味等〕
e 出 + miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 发出，放射
e 出 + miss 送，放出 + ive …的 → 发出的，放射的
inter 在…之间 + mit 送，放出 → 在发送之间〔间断〕→ 暂停，间断
intermit的形容词
miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 送出 → 派遣
mission 派遣；使命 + ary 表人 →〔肩负传教〕使命 → 教士
per 自始至终 + mit 送，放出 → 始终〔允许〕发送 → 许可
permit的名词
permit的形容词
re 一再 + miss 送，放出 → 一再放走，错过的 → 粗心的
re 一再 + mit 送，放出 →〔把钱〕再送出去 → 汇款
sub 下 + mit 送，放出 → 放下 → 屈服
submit的名词
trans 横过 + mit 送，放出 → 跨距离传达、寄送 → 传达
trans 横过，越过 + miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 跨距离转送、传达 → 转送；传达
